content.webTitle: From snowmageddon to snoverkill | Richard Adams

fields.headline: From snowmageddon to snoverkill
fields.bodyText: As Washington DC braces itself for its fourth big snow event in the space of a month, panic-buying grips the nation's capital. Snow shovels and ice-melting salt are sold out everywhere, the district's schools are closed for the rest of the week and most of Congress is shut down. Supermarket shelves are being picked clean of fresh meat, milk, fruit and vegetables – although there seems little prospect of anyone starving as a result. (The Whole Foods near Dupont Circle last night was cleaned out of bananas, broccoli, bagels and Green and Blacks chocolate, which says a lot about the priorities of local customers.) But how bad have things got? Local supermarkets have sold out of condoms. And the area's roofs are caving in. Good news! This being America, souvenir t-shirts are on sale.
